content: this legal case involves a dispute over costs the court appeal resulted in the plaintiff being awarded 93269 eur which the defendant is responsible for covering the case involves the division of multiple real estate properties owned by two individuals who were previously married the court of appeal dismissed an appeal and upheld the order made by the court of first instance the court considered the contributions made by relatives of the exspouses in the construction of a house as a contribution to the whole family however there was an issue with the defendants father and uncles alleged contributions as they were considered the defendants exclusive contribution to the creation of a coowned property the court required an assessment of the value of these contributions the court has made a decision in the case and the appeal has been dismissed the defendant must pay the applicant 93269 eur for the costs of the appeal proceedings the court first instance made a decision regarding a coowned property dispute awarding the applicant a 70 share and the defendant a 30 share the defendant appealed and the high court set aside the original judgment and remitted the case back to the court first instance for a new trial the court will reassess the shares of the coowned property and consider all relevant factors the court of appeal dismissed the appeal and upheld the previous decision the defendant must pay the costs of the appeal proceedings to the applicant the specific laws referenced in the judgment are the marriage family relations act and the civil procedure act
